rComments: He is excited and engaging, but unfortunately, he is not kind. One of the professors I respect the least at this university and have heard him say terrible things about protected classes and seems to think his students aren't very intelligent. Would not recommend him simply because he makes people uncomfortable.

Early Modern East Asia is rarely addressed during daily life, so this class is definitely worth taking. It shows you the East Asia that people hardly talks about. Mind blowing. I love my Korean TA. The professor was okay.

His laugh is infectious and he makes learning fun, though sometimes he forgets to go over what will be in essays/tests. However, there are helpful sections that are held the week before an essay is due/a test. In HIST40A, he uses a weird testing method (non-traditional) but it helps you learn better, imo.

A really good professor that loves what he teaches. May be a little hard to understand but he is hilarious. Would advise to attend all lectures as pop quizzes are frequent. Puts the textbook into PDF so you do not need to buy it!

This one class alone with the charismatic & knowledgable Professor Hu made me change from Psychology to becoming a History major. Literally my favorite professor on the whole campus. Knowledgable, funny, and makes you look forward to attending each class. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

He is so smart! Although he wasn't always on time he really puts 100% into teaching the students. You could ask him any question. He has a hundred different interesting things to say and I walked away from his class feeling like I actually learned something

Can be tricky to know what is expected on essays. Nevertheless, Hu is the most entertaining lecturer I have ever known. Lectures are genuinely interesting, and Hu's also just a really funny guy. Take my word on that.

This guy is all over the place. Comes to class up to 15 min late, but often ends class 15 min early. Lectures are interesting but not really helpful. GO to section if you want to do well. Inconsistent with his word-sometimes gives you a week to prepare for midterm, sometimes just a day. Midterms are 3-4 essays you prepare and memorize beforehand.

Hu wasn't a hard professor to learn from, I hardly used the book, his finals and two midterms are pretty straightforward, he gives you the essay topics ahead of time, if you hit all the points hes looking for you're fine.

Pass on this guy. tries endlessly to explain his essays and tests yet no one understands. Grading is inconsistent. Wrote two essays on the final, one gets a 85 and the other a 45%. Just a quarters worth of frustration if you ask me.

His power points were bland compared to the questions he would ask. The grading always assumed people weren't reading the books and docked you off lots of points. It was very hard to get an A because his questions were too broad but he always expected specific answers.
Hu never used the book. his lectures were clear but his tests and papers were very broad and undefined. I would recommend Hu
His class is pretty interesting! He's a great professor! Take a class from him! He really knows his material! and he makes great powerpoints.

A great teacher the class was chill, even for a summer class! Really knowledgeable about the material. Do the readings and ask for clarification if you dont understand and you should be set. He gave essay questions before the midterms so that we would actually learn and think about the material and be able to write a coherent response. His expectations for an A were a bit high, but when he gives out the questions beforehand, cant really complain.

This class isn't hard to pass but you will have to deal with him always being late and he changes the date of things. When you email him about it, he will give you attitude. Don't miss class even if your life depends on it. His lectures are boring and hard to understand. I passed by doin my own research.

Took this 'Qing China' Class my 1st Quarter at UC. Amazing. He Teaches FLAWLESSLY, utilizes one AMAZING new novel as the Text, and his content knowledge/interest is bar-none. This isn't 'easy', but you'll walk away a powerful history student.  In context, this class is MUCH easier then Chinese Civil Service Exams... remember that! -TPB-

spends half the class period going off on tangents, is not flexible at all with dateline(even if you cant write when someone steals the reserve books), 3 essay questions in one hour for tests. overall one of the worst professors ive had

the way he words his essay prompts and midterm prompts are always confusing, I had to send my TA my essays just to clarify what they wanted me to write about. Way too much work for a lower div, there was a midterm or essay due every friday

Signed up for this class with no prior knowledge of Asian history, with eagerness to learn. However, this Professor's unprofessional behavior, like showing up late every lecture, and sometimes forgetting the slides, made this class awful. No clarity in essay prompts..My TA had to rewrite an essay prompt because no one understood it. NOT RECOMMENDED
Great instructor. I felt more interested in Asian history taking his class than I did before it. Low workload as well, but the material is interesting. He seems nice and approachable as well.

Professor Hu is just great! This class is extremely interesting and Hu really knows his stuff! He is engaging and extremely helpful. Him and Christy really understand the material and what its like being a student. Take this class if you are given the opportunity! It's great!
Lame. Cool, we watched videos I could find on youtube. Lectures were boring, he often didn't show up, and 90% of classes were videos. TA was the only person I learned from.
lectures were pretty boring.  He leaves out all the interesting stuff and lectures on economics and stuff like that

super smart, like he's so smart that when you ask a question, his mind is trying to dumb down the answer so that our undergraduate minds can swallow the genius that is professor hu. the reader was excellent and cheap!(since it was the only text needed)you might not take as much notes in lecture as you thought if you read the reader

I LOVED this class! I can't wait to take another course from Professor Hu. Instead of a heavy midterm and final he gave weekly essay quizzes and gave you the questions beforehand to study! There were 4 papers all only 4-5 pages. The only text was a reader so VERY realistic reading expectations. He's a fantastic lecturer and uber smart. Loved it.

Professor Hu is an amazing teacher! His lectures are engaging and interesting, the material is great and his sense of humor is awesome as well. I'm looking forward to taking his seminar in the Spring. I highly recommend Professor Hu. The reader was heavily used and the only book required for the class. Great class overall.
Professor Hu thinks on seven different levels at one time. He is so smart it is scary. If you want a professor who really knows his subject, Hu Minghui is the man.
